text: Has there been an attempt to avoid implicit logarithmic space errors in Julia using zero-cost abstractions using types? Tried a few searches and found nothing. Do tell me if I am a bit bonkers thinking about it this way as numerical computing is not my strong point.

elements.text: Has there been an attempt to avoid implicit logarithmic space errors in Julia using zero-cost abstractions using types? Tried a few searches and found nothing. Do tell me if I am a bit bonkers thinking about it this way as numerical computing is not my strong point.

text: What I mean here is for example failing to convert to and from logarithmic space as it is common to have functions requiring input in a given space for plenty of libraries.
